newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan stocks end down as OTC market rallies.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan stocks end down as OTC market rallies.

text.p: Taiwan share prices closed slightly lower on Monday as investors switched their trading to the rallying over-the-counter securities market, which has performed strongly in recent days, brokers said.
The index ended down 11.96 points or 0.18 percent at 6,571.12. Turnover was a modest T$36.03 billion.

The OTC market index and turnover have been hitting new record highs in the past week. "The young OTC market, with many potential new shares, has attracted many investors, making them switch part of their money to the OTC market," said Michael Hung, head of research at Nikko Securities.
Brokers also attributed the continued consolidation to foreign funds' stepping to the sidelines.
"Foreign institutions have neared their period of closing books," Hung said. "As the upside potential in the fourth quarter is seen limited, they prefer step to the sidelines."
Many brokers had predicted the index to reach up to 7,000 pionts in the fourth quarter.

Textiles fell most, followed by machinery, financial and plastic shares. Glass and transport shares rose. Constructions and asset-backed shares rose slightly, with BES Engineering up 40 cents to T$26.6.
Electronic shares, which encountered profit-taking in early trade, closed slightly higher, with Mitac International up 50 cents to T$24.1.
Brokers said they expected a consolidation phase to continue later this week, seeing a 6,520-6,600 range on Wednesday.
The market will be closed on Tuesday for a domestic holiday. It will reopen on Wednesday.
